website_summaries.verdict: An affordable model that has the perfect design for various jobs, but the trade off is the subpar attachment components.
pros: Has a practical design for specific leveling jobs including installing pipes, railings, posts and more
Tough molded frame holds up to frequent use
cons: Issues with both components meant for hands-free use have been noted – the strap is flimsy and the magnetic strips are not strong enough to hold onto most surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Works great for 4x4 fence posts, but the rubber band was short lived.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for 4x4 fence posts, but the rubber band did not last long. I replaced it with a small bungee cord.
customer_reviews.author: EJen

customer_reviews.title: Works, can buy elsewhere though
customer_reviews.text: I used this to set up 30+ garden fence posts (8' tall) by myself with good accuracy. This is a very helpful tool but I've since found them for a lot cheaper at the local HF. Also, make sure you have some spare rubber bands (which hold it to the post) or you could get caught in a pinch at the worst possible moment. If you happen to have an appropriate velcro strap handy that would work also but not quite as easy to use as a rubber band.
customer_reviews.author: SixtyFourTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Do not count on the magnets to hold
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help plumb an antenna mast base, made of stainless steel. The magnets were not able to hold it on the 2-1/2 inch diameter base pipe. I had to use the included rubber band. I brought the level into the kitchen and tried it on the corner of the refrigerator's open door. (think refrigerator magnets) The level would not stay in place. As a level for posts and other such items, this level is fine. Just be ready to use a rubber band on metal pipes. The magnets are worthless.
customer_reviews.author: South Tahoe Busman

customer_reviews.title: Irwin makes good tools..just not good rubber bands
customer_reviews.text: Great tool..however the rubber band included is not UV or oil resistant. About 2 weeks sitting in the shop and the rubber band became brittle and crumbled off. Easy fix, however a quality control issue in my opinion. Would buy again...however might go ahead and stock up on rubber bands ahead of time...nothing like needing one and not having it on the jobsite
customer_reviews.author: StoneyRidgeFarmer

customer_reviews.title: Weak magnets will not hold onto pole.
customer_reviews.text: The magnets are not strong enough to hold itself onto a steel pole. I had to use a rubberband which makes the magnets worthless. It is nice to use for posts for leveling them but be ready to hold it by hand. Several times when I first got it, I released it only to have it fall into the hole I had dug. Luckily it didn't become a projectile before the project was finished I have Irwin drill bits that I love so really disappointed with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tim in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Magnets Too Weak
customer_reviews.text: I should have read all of the reviews. This is fine as a level and works as well as the similar magnet-free one that I bought for less, but without the rubber band it just slides right down the steel posts I'm trying to level. I have over 50 posts to level and was thinking it would be a nice time saver. Wrong. Back to the reliable, but fussy (especially with gloves on) rubber band. This is the first time that Irwin has let me down. (This *might* work on square steel posts that would have more surface area in contact with the steel post.)
customer_reviews.author: Small-town Librarian

customer_reviews.title: Arrived defective, two times
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with liquid leaked out of one level bubble. They just let me throw it away and sent a replacement. I thought that was decent service. Second one arrived with the same problem as first. Now they won't refund or replace unless I send back the faulty one. I live in the county with no close UPS drop. Costs more than the level to have them make a special stop. I guess I eat the loss and and consider this a lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Low Budger
customer_reviews.text: I says that it comes with a rubber strap for hands free work". It is a chintzy rubber band. It is not square. The magnets are not very strong. I'm returning it and trying my luck on another one. I'm trying the Kapro 340-08D Magnetic Folding Post Level. They have a video on here look decent. Look for my review on it. Yep. It's confirmed. The Kapro is far superior.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely worth buying, especially if you do any home construction work / upgrades. If you are setting posts you need this to ensure your posts are plumb. Highest recommendation, excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Tools
customer_reviews.text: Just love the products Irwin Tools, so much so that I hunt them down from South Africa knowing that it's always the best! Of course backed up by the Amazon team, assurances and support in worldwide shopping 🛒 makes it a fantastic experience.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Jones (SA7)

customer_reviews.title: The level part works BUT not the magnet.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for putting up metal posts and I am disappointed right away. the magnets on this thing is too weak to even hold up the weight of this level. Other than that the product works. I also got this on sale for $7 so its not that bad but i think i might still return since annoying the crap out of me every time i use it.
customer_reviews.author: Skywalker0175

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for setting straight pipes in concrete. I was setting 4’ pipes (3’ in ground, 1’ above) as sleeves for 15’ poles with owl houses at the top. Level worked like a champ and I had perfectly straight sleeves setting in concrete with no issues. The magnets gripped the steel pole and didn’t slip. Very handy tool.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P

customer_reviews.title: Bubble leaked after a year and 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this post level in 2015. It works well and the price is fantastic but...one year later as I got it out for the 2nd use the middle level bubble had leaked and is now useless. I have other levels of various types that I've had for over 10 years and this is the first case of bubble leakage I've seen. Especially irritating on a tool I've only used once. SO while the price was great I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: ALF Engineer

customer_reviews.title: kinda cheap
customer_reviews.text: I suppose you get what you pay for. The rubber band (the mechanism used to hold the device to the pole) broke after one use. I had some pretty large bands laying around I used to replace and it works fine. A good cheap alternative if you do not install poles for a living.
customer_reviews.author: JIM

customer_reviews.title: Fine Quality Post Level Measure
customer_reviews.text: This two-direction post leveler is just what is needed to build a fence or to frame a house. The blue plastic housing and the green liquid in the leveling tubes make the bubble clearly visible. I gave away one of these by another maker when I 'downsized' only to need one again. This is as good as my previous bi-directional level. I would purchase this Irwin model again (if I were dumb enough to give this one away!)
customer_reviews.author: James EllsworthTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Very good, but a little expensive
customer_reviews.text: The product is good, but I didn't compare the price before I bought it. I found it expensive after I bought it, but then, when I used it on the iron railing, it worked very well because it has a magnet inside.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Works great but handle with care
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well in helping me get my fence posts perpendicular. Glad I had it. However, the glass top bubble, the one that measures horizontal level, broke. Not sure how that happened since I never put it into a tool bag. I remember tossing it onto the grass a few times but don't see how that would have broken the glass. Obviously thin glass so handle with care.
customer_reviews.author: BobPT

customer_reviews.title: Buy this if you are putting up a fence
customer_reviews.text: We were installing a fence and really had only watched you tube videos to find out how to do it. This was worth the money 10 fold. All of the posts are straight and the dog loves having a fenced in yard.
customer_reviews.author: Disney Maven

customer_reviews.title: Makes setting posts easy
customer_reviews.text: This level is versatile and makes setting posts easy instead of moving a standard level around while holding the post. Comes with a rubber band
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I checked this against 2 other similar products and a 4 foot level. Gives inaccurate readings, tossed it aside, can't trust it.
customer_reviews.author: Gdubz

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but priceless
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had this on my past 1,000 projects, such a cheap piece of plastic that is priceless when working on setting a post.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint is that I didn't order several. I would have been able to set several posts and not have to remove the level while they set. Even with only one, it worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: F. Varndell

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Seller
customer_reviews.text: The first one sent was defective and seller replaced it immediately no questions asked. Could have happened to any seller, this was first class service.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great for plumbing posts
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. I read some of the reviews stating that the rubber band breaks easily. Mine didn't, but I only used it to plumb 6 posts across two weekends. If it did break you could easily use another rubber band, some tape, or a screw to keep it in place so I don't see that as a big negative. I used on wooden posts, so I can't comment on how effective the magnet is. It seemed strong enough to hold it in place, although not strong enough to stay on if the post received a hard blow.
customer_reviews.author: E Miller

customer_reviews.title: Professional
customer_reviews.text: I build fences for a living and have a few of these. Awesome product at a great price point. I wouldn't use anything else to level my posts.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C Gillian

customer_reviews.title: You may want more than one!!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I ordered myself an extra. It was indispensable while installing a fence. I could keep one on the last post while installing the next to make sure I didn't knock it out of plumb in the process.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Hood

customer_reviews.title: Gives you three hands when installing posts
customer_reviews.text: I've lost track of how many posts I've installed with this. After a lot of use you will need to replace the rubber band. Each post is perfectly straight - no more levels against the sides of posts. Just install this against the post, wrap the rubber band around so it stays, and hold the top to level, then kick some dirt in to tamp down and hold it while you shovel the rest of the dirt in.
customer_reviews.author: Sirwriter

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat the price. Works perfect
customer_reviews.text: Level is accurate afterultiole readings. Very cheap price. Used rubber bands around to ensure a good hold.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for occasional home diy projects and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It was great to use when building a deck and swing set. Easy to use and nice to not have to hold it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Was a little unwieldy while using on 2" by 2" aluminum pool fence post installs because of it's size (designed more for 4" x4" posts) but did the job nonetheless--fence came out great.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Amazon User1111

customer_reviews.title: Magnetic function is useless
customer_reviews.text: Works fine using the rubber band, but if you want the magnets to hold the level in place on a metal pole, think twice. It just slides down the pole with hardly any magnetic strength.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Could use a bigger level, especially out in the sun. A loop for securing bungee cord around the wood post
customer_reviews.author: TEXPAT101

customer_reviews.title: Good tool.  Too bad about that rubber band.
customer_reviews.text: Any tool with the Irwin name will be a quality tool (Irwin is best known for Vice-Grip pliars). This is no exception. As others have said, the rubber band will live a short life (mine lasted about a day). I use a piece of mason's string with a spring on one end.
customer_reviews.author: David Filmer

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: Probably could have installed my new mailbox pole with a regular level,, but, Been There-Done That. This was a whole lot easier. Now I almost wish I had more projects. Or, not. Can highly recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: TDubiew

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price for tool to make job easier
customer_reviews.text: Used it to install over 600 feet of chain link fence. Worked good 4 star rating since magnets are a little weak and it would slide down pole sometimes
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: Great Level
customer_reviews.text: bought this for leveling my camper, this works great, simply put on camper tongue, it levels the camper in both directions
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Appears useful ....
customer_reviews.text: Tried it, never used it, didn't want to wait around until I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: My Thoughts ....

customer_reviews.title: The magnets don't hold!
customer_reviews.text: The whole purpose for buying this was so the magnets would keep this in place while plumbing the pipe, but they don't! I should have know when I saw they sent a big rubber band with it. I've always thought Irwin tools are a cut above, but this is a piece of plastic junk!!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Makes it easy to set posts and other level dependant projects.
customer_reviews.author: WYOAmazon guy

customer_reviews.title: Very handy tool. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered to aid in the install of 70 post for a privacy fence i'm installing. This saves time if you're working solo as it holds itself to the post, and lets you view if both angles of the post in one shot. Used in for the pickets and cross-braces too. Very handy tool. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: tunedis95

customer_reviews.title: The magnets hold them securely and they are easy to read
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these to leave on my portable two post Dannmar MaxJax car lift so that I can make sure the lift posts are mounted plumb to my floor when installed. The magnets hold them securely and they are easy to read. I wouldn't hesitate to use them for posts etc. if i didn't already have a good 4' level
customer_reviews.author: William Smith

customer_reviews.title: Big help for installing poles
customer_reviews.text: I believe in IRWIN product, so I chooses this post level, it will help you in set up your poles. Hope they could give a better rubber strap.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Li

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Very inexpensive and worked like it's suppose to. These are worth having around. The rubber band was good quality too.
customer_reviews.author: Cale

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Excellent level for the price. I used this to erect a flagpole and it made it so easy to get the pole straight without having to continuously check from various angles. Some people have complained about the rubber band that holds it to the post or pole, but this is a non-issue. If it breaks, just find a large rubber band or as someone suggested, a bungee cord. I'm very pleased with this level.
customer_reviews.author: Fedpro

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate
customer_reviews.text: Works great was a big help when setting our fence posts.
customer_reviews.author: debbie maines

customer_reviews.title: INACCURATE LEVEL...PLASTIC ANGLE BENDS CAUSING ERRORS.
customer_reviews.text: Found this to be inaccurate as it bends a little which throws off the levels. A simple level is more accurate. Waste of money. I would never rely on this item for true level...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me putting in a very large fence.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to put in a huge ornamental metal fence. Kept my posts level and is easy to read. Just gather up some rubber bands before you start because rubber bands decompose as the UV rays from the sun break down the rubber. I went through about 7 rubber bands building the fence that took several months to install working only weekends!
customer_reviews.author: Perry M Young

customer_reviews.title: Hmm
customer_reviews.text: I would have givin it 5 star but the rubber band that is used to strap to the post is a very cheap way to utilize this product
customer_reviews.author: Bret M

customer_reviews.title: Rubber band broke quickly.
customer_reviews.text: This worked really well but we were surprised how quickly the rubber band broke. Now I have to try to find a replacement band.
customer_reviews.author: N. Yoeckel

customer_reviews.title: Made building a privacy fence so easy to level
customer_reviews.text: Used while building a privacy fence in the backyard. These made making sure the poles were level so simple. We only had 7 poles and purchased 7 of these. So simple to put on the poles - comes with large rubber bands to use to wrap around the pole and they stay in place until finished.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Magnet not strong enough to hold on to metal pole
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it had the magnets on it so I wouldn't have to use the rubber band. The magnets aren't strong enough, it slides down the pole
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Works...but rigid design makes it difficult to store safely
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but the rigid design makes storage difficult. I have another similar product which folds and it's much better-suited for being in my toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: Scot

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: easy to read, easy to handle with gloves on, bright color makes it easy to locate in grass or pile of tools. must have for building!!
customer_reviews.author: Peter B

customer_reviews.title: Well built and simply works!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I recently used it to put in a new mailbox and it worked perfectly. Sturdy and well built. I'm not afraid to throw it in a tool bag with other tools.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Its alright
customer_reviews.text: It works good. But the magnets are weak . falls off easily
customer_reviews.author: Caleb morikami

customer_reviews.title: Useless rubber band
customer_reviews.text: Worked for leveling my deck posts. The single rubber band is useless. You are going to need a pack of rubber bands if you are going to use this more than once. If it had a more permanent way to attach to a pole rather than a useless rubber band it would have gotten 5 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: COHwy9

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tool
customer_reviews.text: A great help when setting metal fence posts. Makes it very easy to get them vertical.
customer_reviews.author: G. Oleson

customer_reviews.title: Irwin makes a quality product
customer_reviews.text: You can trust this brand to perform as it's intended, accurately.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Know-it-all

customer_reviews.title: Worked great with the Quickrete fast setting post concrete
customer_reviews.text: Setting a fence post was a two man job, but this really made into a one man job. Used it to set 12 4x4 posts for a wooden fence on a slope. Worked great with the Quickrete fast setting post concrete.
customer_reviews.author: Jessse D

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I used to install a replacement mast for my satellite due to low signals on the original install. Getting the mast plumb was easy enough task with this device, and signals are now where they should be. It won't be the most robust tool in your chest, but it does the job. I wish the folks who did the original install had one with them.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K Bell

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, pleasant surprise
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to help with installing our chicken coop/run. Was very helpful during the installation and leveling of the main posts. Found this product incidentally but so glad we did.
customer_reviews.author: Leahn

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: Great tool to have in your tool box. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Lynda

customer_reviews.title: Works great and frees up a hand
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a project I will be doing in a few months. I will be setting five posts and I wanted a level that I could use without having to hold. This is perfect. It is larger than most post levels and I got a better deal on Amazon than any local stores.
customer_reviews.author: psigstad

customer_reviews.title: Really good idea, quality control needed.
customer_reviews.text: Lost liquid out of one of the tube making it nearly useless.
customer_reviews.author: MAGMA

customer_reviews.title: What a cool product
customer_reviews.text: This post level made installing my fence posts so much easier. If I was smart enough to realize the rubber band was to be used to hold the thing to the post, it would have been that much better :-) anyway - my posts came out nice and straight using this level. I can't imagine it getting any easier!
customer_reviews.author: S. Porcher

customer_reviews.title: Works great for leveling 4x4 fence posts. 5 Star *****
customer_reviews.text: Works great for leveling 4x4 fence posts. 5 Star ***** Installed a fence recently and this level worked better than expected, the fence turned out great and it is level and straight. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Very useful.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to put about 14 fence posts. This is a must have for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but if using warped/cca posts, I highly recommend also using a 4' level! And the rubber band could be a bit thicker or heavier duty.
customer_reviews.author: Stu M.

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe I have gone all these years without this ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe I have gone all these years without this. Putting in new fence posts was a lot easier with this level.
customer_reviews.author: Coastal Reader

customer_reviews.title: Silly rubber-band
customer_reviews.text: This post level is similar to others on the market and is fairly accurate and certainly more convenient than using a regular level. The magnets stuck to a 4X4 metal post and held the tool in place. When used on a wooden post, you're supposed to employ the included rubber-band to hold it in position. While the rubber-band works, its size limits it to about a 4X4. What a silly thing to include with a tool. I just used a bungee cord to hold the thing in place. This way it works on posts of any size.
customer_reviews.author: robosolo

customer_reviews.title: Get one, even if you don't need one, you need one!
customer_reviews.text: This was invaluable with a recent fence build. It was super handy and I was able to use it one handed without issue, a bargain at twice the price!
customer_reviews.author: ThePapa

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for setting up his weather station
customer_reviews.text: Gift for husband. Worked great for setting up his weather station.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon R. Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Great tool. A necessity for building a fence or ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. A necessity for building a fence or any other structure. Very durable as well. Easy to read the bubble level.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hodgkins

customer_reviews.title: Best $8 I ever spent
customer_reviews.text: Made fence post installation a lot easier to insure posts were level and plum.
customer_reviews.author: Marko V

customer_reviews.title: I did not use the magnetic portion of this level ...
customer_reviews.text: I did not use the magnetic portion of this level, however it did help to set 15 posts perfectly level. This is something you will want if you plan on doing fence posts.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R

customer_reviews.title: Leaky vial
customer_reviews.text: At first, it worked great. After 7 months, one of the vials leaked out. At that time, I checked the remaining vials against my 4 ft level that I have had for many years. The bubble in one of the the remaining vials was way off. If I had used it, I would have had a off-level post! I contacted IRWIN, no response. This is the last IRWIN tool I will ever buy. UPDATE: 9/23/17 they emailed me after about a week, and asked for a picture, which i sent. they are sending another one to me.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Prophet

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing, works even on emt we drove into the ground. Had to hold it on a little tighter with the vibrations but wow... so easy to level a post.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Bord

customer_reviews.title: We used this product to level some fence posts, ...
customer_reviews.text: We used this product to level some fence posts, and it worked really well. We used a rubber band to secure it to the post, and had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Chase J. Bellott

customer_reviews.title: Good post level!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this four stars only because the rubber band broke the first time I used it. Granted, I used string or could have replaced the rubber band, but it came with the level and therefore is part of the product I'm rating. A one time use retaining band that comes with this product is unacceptable. I'd be okay with Irwin bumping the price up a nickle if they'd include a really industrial strength rubber band. Or, just let the customer know they need string or a rubber band to secure the thing and drop the price a nickle. The level itself is great and once secured to a post, performed perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Totally ImAussieBull

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Makes setting posts easy and helps level in all directions
customer_reviews.author: Sandbergs

customer_reviews.title: Info about the magnets
customer_reviews.text: The magnets are not strong enough to keep this from sliding down the fence post (I used this on thick-wall terminal posts). I had to also use the rubber band to keep it secure. This is made of nice sturdy plastic, and overall worked well to keep the posts level.
customer_reviews.author: D. Coral

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Works with both metal and non metal ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works with both metal and non metal post. Only downside to it is you can't replace the levels of they break. They are molded into it. I've seen others that are replaceable.
customer_reviews.author: zharrisfamily

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I use it to put up a metal fence around my pool. It was nice to have both directions of plumb without moving the level.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Mine came in with one of the level bulbs broken but for the price... not bad. The rubber band didn't last long either but my expectations were very low in the first place. It should work for at least the duration of a small fencing job.
customer_reviews.author: rtk11226

customer_reviews.title: It is a level... it works. ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a level... it works... the Irwin name ain't what she used to be but hard to go wrong with this simple reasonably priced device.
customer_reviews.author: ZCyclesTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Takes a lot of effort out of aligning posts
customer_reviews.text: Set 32 4x4 posts with this, exactly plumb, without having to use batterboards. If you're setting posts, you need this.
customer_reviews.author: Legend9Nine

customer_reviews.title: It did what it was designed to do.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to install a 20ft flag pole. It served its purpose admirably. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Walter B

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for installing a fence
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for setting posts and concrete. Makes it a one man job.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: adequate and did the job
customer_reviews.text: rubber band didn't last. I will likely fit some shock cord or bungee cord to it. magnets are so-so. I used this to put about 20 T-Posts in the ground and level. It was adequate and did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Spd_Rcr

customer_reviews.title: Love This Level
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these about half way through building my fence. My only regret is that I didn't buy it earlier. Great Product. The only downfall is after sitting in my garage for about 8 months the rubber bands broke but that wasn't a big deal because I just replaced it with a regular rubber band from my office. Love This Level
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mohon

customer_reviews.title: Magnets do not stick to the steel fence posts
customer_reviews.text: The level is great except that the magnets are not sticking to the fence posts. It is kind of the whole point to this level.
customer_reviews.author: Kirstin Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Helped tons. I was Installing wooden posts and using the rubber band it includes. Works great and nice and sturdy material survived falls without damage.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Estrada

customer_reviews.title: this item does not stay well on posts for chain-link ...
customer_reviews.text: this item does not stay well on posts for chain-link fences...it fell down the whole time we had to hold it on. It did work otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: RoscoeKoopa151

customer_reviews.title: Simple but effective
customer_reviews.text: This one is what it is, a simple, cheap post level. Works well. I imagine the 'strap' (rubber band) will fail quickly. But since it is just a rubber band it is easy enough to replace. I would suggest this for someone looking for a cheap but effective post level.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ricker

customer_reviews.title: Level works great. Had a Rubber band to hold to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Level works great. Had a Rubber band to hold to the post. Would be nice for a better provided attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Sumsion

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool!
customer_reviews.text: You can't put a post in perfectly straight singlehanded without this ingenious tool, get one now!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jemmett

customer_reviews.title: Great product. After using it fit 24 post
customer_reviews.text: Great product. After using it fit 24 post. The rubber band frayed. Maybe this should come with at least 2 rubber bands.
customer_reviews.author: miguel marte

customer_reviews.title: A good level.
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have tool when setting fence posts. The level isn't fancy, but works well.
customer_reviews.author: Farmboy

customer_reviews.title: I used this to install my mailbox and it worked ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to install my mailbox and it worked perfectly. Sure you might not set posts everyday but its cheap and worth having in your collection.
customer_reviews.author: ABAllen2010

customer_reviews.title: Works okay, magnet is a little weak for holding on metal round posts.
customer_reviews.text: Magnet is a little weak so I used the rubber band to hold it on my round metal galvanized fence posts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: IRWIN Tools Magnetic Post Level (1794482),Blue
product_meta.description: This level has a magnetic strip and a rubber strap for convenient hands-free installation of posts, railings, pipes, and more. Allows you to plumb and level posts, poles, pipes, railings and more. Molded frame is durable in all conditions. IRWIN Tools Magnetic Post Level (1794482)
feature_bullets: This level has a magnetic strip and a rubber strap for convenient hands-free installation of posts, railings, pipes, and more
Allows you to plumb and level posts, poles, pipes, railings and more
Molded frame is durable in all conditions
